title: Are you not allowed to have fun anymore?
body: So its the first game of the day, i go to play a normal game, and say in champ select, I'm gonn paly AP blitz. I missed a few hooks and severely underestimated lulu's early damage, but damn, i got flamed and called toxic, for trying to have fun, in a normal game. Is this not allowed anymore?

replies.body: ;( ignore the haters man, just play what you want to :)
Unless it's Singed Support with Smite... then Riot will ban you.

You know perfectly well he was banned because he was a total arsehole, and not because he played Singed support with smite.

He forced himself into the roll, even if he was supposed to be another roll, he intentionally let his ADC die over and over by leaving them to 1v2 situations every game, and refused to listen to every single person he played with.

He was banned for being a toxic piece of shit, not because of Singed support.

except if you look at the situation, he explained what he was doing in lobby, he kind of supported between sprees of counterjungling (I do pretty much the same thing with shaco or nunu support, minus smite), he wasn't toxic and even though it had a subpar winrate compared to his regular singed top play, it was by no means nonviable if you look at how well he managed to pull it off. 

Later riot even repealed the ban.

Explaining what you're going to be doing doesn't outright equal communicating with your team, especially if your team doesn't agree to it, and that was the issue.
He forced himself into doing what he wanted to do, no matter what his teams wanted.
Even if he wasn't given the role of support but auto-filled to another roll like top or mid or jungle whatever.

Just because he explained what he was going to do, doesn't make him non-toxic.
The ban was "repealed" after it's full term, so he still had to live out the full length of the ban.

Doing a playstyle or build that isn't meta should not be subject to the discernment of teammates, you play to the best of your ability to win, if someone wants to go magic pen mundo support, or ad blitzcrank top, crit malphite or tank shaco, the only requirement should be 'can they pull it off'.

This is soloq not LCS, as long as you aren't running it down mid and inting, your teammates have no right to claim any grievance over your build or playstyle so long as you play to win, and there isn't a single line in riot's own statement about player behaviour that disagrees with this. You can 'communicate' your intentions but beyond that, your teammates have no right to decide how you should play.

Well mainly, just learn this trick I like to call the mute button, it's where you go into chat and type " /mute all " and you successfully improved your game . If however u want to talk to your team mates, it would be best to play with friends say like on team speak or discord maybe even Skype but otherwise good luck lul
The issue is now, i may have been reported for that ggame, and i dont want to lose honour standing :c

Reports don't matter if they aren't valid. If you didn't flame them back then you have nothing to worry about, they're the ones being toxic asshats.

Just as you won't be punished for invalid reports, no matter the number, you won't lose honour either.

let people be toxic, there is no rule that you have to build in the standard way, and you can't be reported for losing lane (as much as many would want this feature, though 'unskilled' report should be brought back imo).

personally I feel ad blitzcrank top is superior to ap blitz, and I especially like playing crit shiv malphite when I'm bored.
What kind of logic is that. Just because someone flames at you and is toxic doesnt meant you cant have fun. Fun can be portrayed in many perspectives..... bruh dont bog yourself down lol
